subject: Investing
title: Proof of Work vs. Proof of Stake
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Proof of Work vs. Proof of Stake.

hook.text: Bitcoin uses more electricity than some countries. Ethereum slashed its energy use 99% by switching one rule.

buildup.text: Proof of Work requires miners to solve puzzles using massive computing power to validate transactions.

discovery.text: Proof of Stake replaces miners with validators who lock up coins as collateral to earn the right to validate.

twist.text: Both achieve the same goal‚Äîpreventing fraud‚Äîbut with vastly different energy and hardware requirements.

climax.text: PoS makes cheating expensive by slashing your staked coins, while PoW makes it expensive via electricity bills.

punchline.text: Same trust, different cost. That's the core debate in consensus design.

quiz.question: How does Proof of Stake reduce energy use?
options: Validators lock up coins instead of solving puzzles
